intro: Nauclea taiwaniana, commonly known as the Taiwan nauclea, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered white or pinkish flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
